snippet: Sales dropped 0.6 percent in February as snowstorms kept Americans at home. Consumers spent less at restaurants and home improvement stores.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports retail sales in United States fell 0.6 percent in February; harsh winter weather most likely affected sales.
lead_paragraph: Sales dropped 0.6 percent in February as snowstorms kept Americans at home. Consumers spent less at restaurants and home improvement stores.

headline.main: Harsh Weather a Factor as U.S. Retail Sales Fall
headline.print_headline: Harsh Weather a Factor as U.S. Retail Sales Fall
